item.title: An Interesting Fact About Logarithms
item.description: Today I learned something interesting about logarithms. Namely, that: $$\lg x \approx \ln x + \log x$$ with less than 1% error! The “proof” behind this is as follows: $$\frac{\ln x + \log x}{\lg x} = \frac{\frac{\lg x}{\lg e} + \frac{\lg x}{\lg 10}}{\lg x}$$ $$= \frac{(\lg e + \lg 10)(\lg x)}{\lg x \lg 10 \lg e}$$ $$= \frac{1}{\lg e} + \frac{1}{\lg 10}$$ $$ = \ln 2+ \log 2 $$ The above is approximately equivalent to $0.
